TopicTitle: Less memory usage by using OpenGL

Articles.Content:
Just noticed the lack of shadows, but if the choice is between having shadows and being able to play the game for longer than 10 minutes, I choose playing the game.

Well, while OpenGL makes the game run faster in my end, it also doesn't render shadows, making landing harder. Not worth the extra speed boost.

It is a double edged sword, some people report choppy simulation/physics time when in Opengl. This is why I switched back to D3D. My sim time twitched between green and yellow even with a 5 part rocket.

Is there any visual feedback that lets you know you are actually in OpenGL (like text or anything?)

The top of ksp.log will tell you what renderer it's trying to use. Line 7 of mine:

SM: 50 (Direct3D 11.0 [level 11.0])

If OGL doesn't work and you have DX9 issues it's still worth trying DX11 - I had to turn atmo effects down to minimum & there are a few other issues, but it's mostly playable. Maybe not if you have a Minmus base...
So far I have been running Win KSP .90 x64 with zero hickups without OpenGL. All I wish to see is the ability to upgrade the complex in career. :-/

Has anyone found a fix yet? The games crashed over 100 times for me

http://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/CommandLineArguments.htmlcheck this out, force open d3d11 works except the shows and sph and vab ground markings dont show up, but it stops the game from crashing, d3d9 doesnt work

tempory opengl fix

1.make a ksp shortcut

2. Run the game

3. Go to setting then graphics

4. Disable full screen

5. Close ksp

6. Right click the ksp shortcut you made

7. Click onproperties

8. In target, put -force-opengl -popupwindow %command%

9. Press apply and ok

10. Run ksp and enjoy

if that doesnt work, try this instead --force-opengl -popupwindow %command%

the game should run in fullscreen and when you hit the windows key, your taskbar should come up and to hide it, press the game screen again
